articles.description: Follow live text updates from day three of the fourth Test between India and England in Ranchi.
articles.title: India v England: Fourth Test, day three - text updates

articles.description: "Efficient" Arsenal are showing they have "no fear" as they maintain their momentum in the title race with a big win against Newcastle.
articles.title: 'We are living the dream' - Arsenal showing 'no fear'

articles.description: Switzerland's Marco Odermatt wins his third consecutive overall Alpine World Cup title with victory in California.
articles.title: Alpine World Cup: Marco Odermatt wins third World Cup title with 10 races to go

articles.description: England silenced Murrayfield early on but made too many mistakes as Scotland recovered to retain the Calcutta Cup in the Six Nations, says Matt Dawson.
articles.title: 'England's capitulation disappointing after starting so well'

articles.description: Scotland winger Duhan van der Merwe made the difference as his hat-trick broke England in the Calcutta Cup at Murrayfield.
articles.title: How Van der Merwe broke England 'emotionally'

articles.description: Wigan win a dramatic World Club Challenge against Penrith Panthers after being on the right end of two key video reviews.
articles.title: World Club Challenge: Wigan Warriors 16-12 Penrith Panthers - Cherry and Whites crowned world champions for fifth time

articles.description: Pep Guardiola calls his Man City players "supermen" as they keep up their chase for a fourth straight Premier League title by beating Bournemouth.
articles.title: Manchester City players are 'supermen' - Guardiola

articles.description: Harry Kane scores a stoppage-time winner as Bayern Munich beat RB Leipzig to pick up an important win in the Bundesliga title race.
articles.title: Kane hits stoppage-time winner as Bayern beat Leipzig

articles.description: Liverpool will aim to stay on course for a quadruple in Sunday's EFL Cup final, while Chelsea bid for their first domestic trophy in six years.
articles.title: Pochettino asks for patience before cup final

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag insists the future is positive for the Old Trafford club despite losing at home to Fulham for only the second time in 61 years.
articles.title: 'Bigger picture very good' - Ten Hag remains upbeat
